pull-up.description: Hang from a pull-up bar with straight arms, then pull until your chin clears the bar. Lower back down under control.
tips: Set shoulders down before pulling (avoid shrugging)
Keep ribs down and core tight (no swinging)

push-up.description: From a high plank, lower chest toward the floor with elbows ~45° to torso, then press back to full extension without losing body line.

push-ups.description: From a high plank, lower chest toward the floor with elbows ~45° to torso, then press back to full extension without losing body line.

bar-bench.description: Lie on a bench and press a bar from chest level to lockout, then lower it with control.
tips: Plant feet and keep your upper back tight
Lower to mid-chest with wrists stacked over elbows
Press up smoothly—don’t bounce off the chest

bar-row.description: Hinge at the hips with a flat back and row the bar toward your lower ribs/upper stomach, then lower with control.
tips: Keep spine neutral and brace your core
Pull elbows back and squeeze shoulder blades

bar-rows.description: Hinge at the hips with a flat back and row the bar toward your lower ribs/upper stomach, then lower with control.

Pull elbows back and squeeze shoulder blades

lateral-raise.description: Lift dumbbells out to the sides to shoulder height with a slight elbow bend, then lower slowly.

skull-crusher.description: Lying down, lower the weight toward your forehead by bending elbows, then extend elbows to press back up.
tips: Keep elbows pointed up and fairly still
Stop if elbows feel sharp pain

skull-crushers.description: Lying down, lower the weight toward your forehead by bending elbows, then extend elbows to press back up.

Stop if elbows feel sharp pain

bicep-curl.description: Curl the weight up by bending the elbows, keeping upper arms mostly still, then lower under control.
tips: Keep elbows close to your sides

bicep-curls.description: Curl the weight up by bending the elbows, keeping upper arms mostly still, then lower under control.
tips: Keep elbows close to your sides

fly.description: With a slight elbow bend, open arms wide and lower the weights until you feel a chest stretch, then bring them back together.
tips: Keep a soft bend in elbows throughout
Move slow—this is not a heavy lift

flies.description: With a slight elbow bend, open arms wide and lower the weights until you feel a chest stretch, then bring them back together.

farmer-carry.description: Hold heavy weights at your sides with a tall posture and walk steadily for the prescribed time.
tips: Brace your core and keep ribs down
